trans-unit.source: Provides access to the mapping between configuration-file virtual and physical paths.
<xref:System.Web.Configuration.IConfigMapPath> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
Gets the virtual-directory name associated with a specific site.
<xref:System.Web.Configuration.IConfigMapPath.GetAppPathForPath%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
A unique identifier for the site.
The URL associated with the site.
The siteID must be unique.
No two sites share the same id.
The siteID distinguishes sites that have the same name.
Populates the default site name and the site ID.
<xref:System.Web.Configuration.IConfigMapPath.GetDefaultSiteNameAndID%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The default site name.
A unique identifier for the site.
Gets the machine-configuration file name.
<xref:System.Web.Configuration.IConfigMapPath.GetMachineConfigFilename%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The machine-configuration file name.
Populates the directory and name of the configuration file based on the site ID and site path.
<xref:System.Web.Configuration.IConfigMapPath.GetPathConfigFilename%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
A unique identifier for the site.
The URL associated with the site.
The physical directory of the configuration path.
The name of the configuration file.
Gets the name of the configuration file at the Web root.
<xref:System.Web.Configuration.IConfigMapPath.GetRootWebConfigFilename%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The name of the configuration file at the Web root.
Gets the physical directory path based on the site ID and URL associated with the site.
<xref:System.Web.Configuration.IConfigMapPath.MapPath%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
A unique identifier for the site.
The URL associated with the site.
The physical directory path.
Populates the site name and site ID based on a site argument value.
If `siteArgument` is `null`, is equal to the default site name, or is equal to the default site identifier, the `siteName` and `siteID` are populated with the default site values.
<xref:System.Web.Configuration.IConfigMapPath.ResolveSiteArgument%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The site name or site identifier.
The default site name.
A unique identifier for the site.
